FuncDef:
The aps working command configures an interface as the working interface in an LMSP group.
The undo aps working command cancels the preceding settings.
By default, an interface does not function as a working interface in an LMSP group.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IP address of the Device where the protecting interfaces that are in the same LMSP group as the protect group is located. Usually, the value is the IP address of the loopback interface on the Device.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the IP address of a local Router . Usually, the value is the IP address of the loopback interface on the Router.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure an interface as the working interface in an LMSP group, run the aps working command. The working interface must be specified for the working link in an LMSP group.
Prerequisites
Before you configure an interface as the working interface of an LMSP group, add the interface to the LMSP group.
Precautions
If single-chassis LMSP is used, particularly when the working and protection interfaces of an LMSP group are on the same Router, you do not need to configure peer-ip or local-ip when specifying the protection interface for an LMSP group.
The POS interface view does not support the peer-ip and local-ip parameter.
